bio.summary: I'm a professional sofware developer, author, speaker, and private Python tutor. He is the author of the popular Python book 'Writing Idiomatic Python'. I'm always looking for a new challenge.

work.summary: Wrote high-frequency, ultra-low latency equity trading systems in C++.
highlights: Part of team of 5 that designed and implemented Goldman's next-generation order management system, OM2.
Lead project to migrate all of Goldman's Programatic Trading business onto the new OMS.
Mentored younger teammates in both official and unofficial capacity.

work.summary: Lead developer on C++ OMS team. Designed and implemented next-generation OMS from scratch with team of four.
highlights: Lead developer on team responsible for sucessfully writing from scratch a distributed, sub-millisecond OMS.
Developed a release management system in spare time and moved group onto it. Now used by most front-office teams.
Lead a number of projects aimed at improving regulatory compliance by working with compliance, back office, QA teams.
Undertook many successful, self-directed reasearch projects that optimized various components in OMS using template metaprogramming, profiling, kernel-level optimization, etc.

work.summary: Team lead on both Data Team (Hadoop, Hive, Vertica, Netezza, etc.) and Fraud Engineering Team
highlights: Successfully designed and implemented a system and REST API responsible for scheduling data pipeline jobs and reporting state of pipeline (Python, Flask)
Simplified and re-wrote Anti-Fraud Technology Platform, resulting in increased functionality, decreased complexity, and greater customer confidence
One of four initial 'Engineering Leads' (company-wide) on major cross-functional engineering project. Sucessfully added support for and automation of external network mediation data.
